author: dantraMSFT
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

Run resxgen.ps1 from tools\resxgen.

```powershell
.\ResxGen.ps1 -Manifest ..\..\src\PowerShell.Core.Instrumentation\PowerShell.Core.Instrumentation.man -ResxPath ..\..\src\System.Management.Automation\resources -CodePath ..\..\src\System.Management.Automation\gen
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
escape characters such as %t and %n in manifest messages are translated the tab and newline characters.

Actual behavior
---------------
The escape characters are passed through without change.

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17076
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
Example log entry is pasted below, see the character `%n` in it.
```
Jan 12 15:24:16 dongbo-ub powershell[8244]: (v6.0.0:E:11) [Command_Lifecycle:CommandStart.Method.Informational] Command TabExpansion2 is Started.
%n%nContext:%n        Severity = Informational
        Host Name = ConsoleHost
        Host Version = 6.0.0
        Host ID = 05532e92-2b6c-4fcb-8feb-958b3109b433
        Host Application = /opt/microsoft/powershell/6.0.0/pwsh.dll
        Engine Version = 6.0.0
        Runspace ID = d2acbe66-7422-471f-95dd-f411957a965b
        Pipeline ID = 56
        Command Name = TabExpansion2
        Command Type = Function
        Script Name = 
        Command Path = 
        Sequence Number = 458
        User = dongbo-ub\dongbo
        Connected User = 
        Shell ID = Microsoft.PowerShell
%n%nUser Data:%n%n
```
Note that by default the rsyslog will escape control characeters from the log message, and newline character is one of them. So by default you will see all log text appear in one line in syslog and newline character will be replaced to be `#012`. The example above is what shows up after setting `$EscapeControlCharactersOnReceive off` in `/etc/rsyslog.conf`

title: Resxgen.psm1 is not translating manifest escape characters.
